5.  Any airport taxes and administration fees included in the cost of your Flights.
6.  Any positive diagnosis of COVID-19 within 3 days of the Issue Date as indicated in the Policy Schedule or Endorsement Letter for the purpose of changing Your Travel Insurance Plan or the addition of Insured Person to Your Policy.
7.  The use for any air miles, holiday points, membership or credit card redemption You use to pay for all or part of Your Trip.

questions: How does the policy treat airport taxes and administration fees included in the flight cost when calculating reimbursement for trip cancellation or interruption?
In what way does a positive COVID-19 diagnosis within 3 days before the policy issue date affect eligibility for changing the travel insurance plan or adding an insured person?
What are the implications of using air miles, holiday points, membership rewards, or credit card redemptions to pay for part or all of a trip on the coverage and claim settlement?
How does the policy define 'Fully Vaccinated,' and what are the consequences on coverage if the insured person is not fully vaccinated?
If a traveler is diagnosed with COVID-19 two days before purchasing or changing their travel insurance plan, how does this affect their ability to modify coverage or add insured persons?
When a trip is paid partially with credit card points and partially with cash, how does the policy handle claims related to the portion paid with points versus cash?
Are airport taxes and administration fees refundable under trip cancellation benefits, and how does their inclusion in flight costs influence claim amounts?
What documentation is required to prove full vaccination status, and how does failure to provide this documentation impact claims related to COVID-19?
If an insured person is not fully vaccinated and contracts COVID-19 during the trip, how does this affect coverage under COVID-19 related benefits or exclusions?
How does the policy address claims if the insured person attempts to change their travel insurance plan after receiving a positive COVID-19 diagnosis within the specified 3-day window?
Does the use of loyalty points or air miles to pay for a trip affect the calculation of insured trip cost limits or deductibles?
In cases where airport taxes are separately itemized on the flight invoice, how does the policy treat these fees in relation to coverage limits or exclusions?
What are the policy implications if an insured person is partially vaccinated or has an exemption but is not considered fully vaccinated under the policy terms?
How does the timing of a positive COVID-19 diagnosis relative to the policy issue date influence the ability to add new insured persons to an existing policy?
If a traveler uses a combination of air miles and cash to pay for flights, and the trip is canceled, how does the policy determine the reimbursable amount?
Are there any exclusions or limitations specifically related to airport taxes and administration fees when a trip is interrupted or curtailed?
How does the policy handle claims if the insured person was not fully vaccinated due to medical exemption but did not meet the policy's vaccination criteria?
What is the interaction between the exclusion for not being fully vaccinated and any general policy exclusions related to communicable diseases like COVID-19?
If an insured person is diagnosed with COVID-19 four days after the policy issue date, how does this affect their ability to change the travel insurance plan or add insured persons?
How does the policy define the 'Issue Date,' and why is this definition critical in relation to the 3-day COVID-19 diagnosis exclusion for plan changes or additions?
